channel.title: ::commands
channel.description:
Well, How can I make my ::commands so a window will pop-up with the things I want in it? I know I have to do something with public void, but what..
If anyone knows how and could help me, please post.
Christiaan20 :)

item.title: ::commands
item.dc:creator: @supra_s supra s
item.description:
@supra_s wrote:

public void NAME HERE E.G commands()

=

public void YOURNAME()

the only thing you cant change is “public void” end “()”

Read full topic

item.description:

Thank you, It helped

I got :

public void Commands() {

Do i need to make it:

public void CommandsMenu() {

Read full topic

item.title: ::commands
item.dc:creator: @Evanz Evanz
item.description:
@Evanz wrote:

Add this to your voids, change what it says in the "sendMessage(“Text here”);

public void NAME HERE E.G commands() { clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("Close Window", 3024); endQuest("Evanz", 3026); sendQuest("Scape", 3027); sendQuest("Is", 3028); sendQuest("Currently", 3029); sendQuest("Under", 3030); sendQuest("Construction", 3031); sendQuest("", 3032); sendQuest("Please log out now", 3033); sendQuest("", 3034); sendQuest("", 3035); sendQuest("", 3036); sendQuest("", 3037); showInterface(3023); flushOutStream(); }

Then add this to your commands

if(command.startsWith("COMMAND NAME")) { VOIDNAMEHERE(); }

Read full topic
